content:
Yes, I definitely think that my experience playing Algernon will inform my approach to acting in general. I've learned the importance of delving deep into a character's backstory and psyche to understand their motivations and behaviors. I realize now that it's not just about memorizing lines and reciting them on stage, but about becoming the character and living their experiences.

I think this approach will help me to bring more authenticity and nuance to future roles. By taking the time to develop a rich backstory for each character, I'll be able to make more informed choices and bring a deeper level of understanding to my performances.

I'm also excited to explore different techniques and exercises to help me get into character. For example, I'd like to try more improvisation exercises to help me discover new aspects of a character's personality and behavior. I'd also like to experiment with different physicality and vocal work to find the character's unique traits and mannerisms.
